title: CoinageMint
author: CoinageMint
created_time: September 04, 2022, 09:10:24 AMLast edit: September 04, 2022, 09:47:26 AM by CoinageMint
content: "A new Australian 50c piece released today comes with a hidden code only the sharpest of people will be able to crack"Not crypto but collectible related. I thought some members here might be interested in the new Australian $0.50 coinhttps://www.news.com.au/finance/money/secret-code-hidden-in-new-50c-coin-released-this-week/news-story/d027dc8b2c92b4d9ad7d1c73540ab340

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Interesting coin and concept... too bad this came out in 2019. Wonder if anyone cracked the code?

comments.author: CoinageMint
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on September 04, 2022, 10:03:22 AMInteresting coin and concept... too bad this came out in 2019. Wonder if anyone cracked the code?Sorry i posted the wrong link first, this is the new 2022 coin

comments.author: jackpotato
comments.body: how can i get one.I checked the royal mint web,there is no link or on list.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: jackpotato on September 05, 2022, 09:01:44 AMhow can i get one.I checked the royal mint web,there is no link or on list.Tons on ebay...looks like some are already going for $70+ in bids... may be an expensive 50 cent piece https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&_trksid=p2334524.m570.l1313&_nkw=2022+50c+australian+signals&_sacat=0&LH_TitleDesc=0&_odkw=2022+50+cent+australia&_osacat=0

comments.author: CoinageMint
comments.created_time: September 06, 2022, 02:32:04 AMLast edit: September 06, 2022, 03:16:19 AM by CoinageMint
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on September 05, 2022, 10:21:45 AMQuote from: jackpotato on September 05, 2022, 09:01:44 AMhow can i get one.I checked the royal mint web,there is no link or on list.Tons on ebay...looks like some are already going for $70+ in bids... may be an expensive 50 cent piece https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&_trksid=p2334524.m570.l1313&_nkw=2022+50c+australian+signals&_sacat=0&LH_TitleDesc=0&_odkw=2022+50+cent+australia&_osacat=0Wow, i will have to look at the local cost of these, they usually sell them at the post officeI think they are going to be a circulated coin, so you should be able to pick up some cheap ones soonEdit: Looks like they could already be sold out, only 50k produced

comments.author: jackpotato
comments.body: Quote from: CoinageMint on September 06, 2022, 02:32:04 AMQuote from: minerjones on September 05, 2022, 10:21:45 AMQuote from: jackpotato on September 05, 2022, 09:01:44 AMhow can i get one.I checked the royal mint web,there is no link or on list.Tons on ebay...looks like some are already going for $70+ in bids... may be an expensive 50 cent piece https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&_trksid=p2334524.m570.l1313&_nkw=2022+50c+australian+signals&_sacat=0&LH_TitleDesc=0&_odkw=2022+50+cent+australia&_osacat=0Wow, i will have to look at the local cost of these, they usually sell them at the post officeI think they are going to be a circulated coin, so you should be able to pick up some cheap ones soonEdit: Looks like they could already be sold out, only 50k producedha,too crazy price on ebay,only 50c,wait for circulating.

comments.author: nullama
comments.created_time: September 09, 2022, 12:53:58 AMLast edit: September 09, 2022, 01:36:05 AM by nullama
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on September 04, 2022, 10:03:22 AMInteresting coin and concept... too bad this came out in 2019. Wonder if anyone cracked the code?Yeah, the previous coin was cracked:Quote from: https://www.ramint.gov.au/publications/asio-encrypted-message-on-royal-australian-mint-coin-revealedFollowing the recent completion of the competition, the Mint can now reveal that the secret message on the coin reads “there is no greater honour than the trust of the Australian people or weightier burden than protecting the security of Australia and its people”.Queensland’s very own Andrew Olsson is the winner of the only proof coin in existence that featuring the 70th Anniversary of ASIO coin design.This is how the new coin looks:It is sold out already in the Royal Australian Mint, but you can get it from resellers on ebay, etc.Quote from: https://www.news.com.au/finance/money/secret-code-hidden-in-new-50c-coin-released-this-week/news-story/d027dc8b2c92b4d9ad7d1c73540ab340"The commemorative 50c coin contains four kinds of secret code.""Like the early code breakers in ASD, you can get through some of the layers with but a pencil and paper but, right towards the end, you may need a computer to solve the last level"

comments.author: CoinageMint
comments.body: Yeah sold out everywhere.Could be worth getting from eBay, there won't be any more with the queen on one side anymore
